intro: Heterosicyos stenolobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed prickly pear, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spineless stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, fleshy stems that store water, a typical adaptation to arid environments. Its leaves are usually reduced to spines, and it produces edible fruits that are similar to those of other prickly pear species. The plant is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water.
